Name: The Whisper of Memories
Description: A robot active on the suspension platform is emitting strange sounds…
QuestDesc: A robot active on the suspension platform is emitting strange sounds…

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sob) I remember how you loved sitting here, feeling the breeze, Xiao... You'd read your web novels here for hours... (sob) but now you'll never get to see how they end...
Liuqi... (sniff) you were only with us for two days, and then... I remember showing you this view, talking about the future we'd build together... (Sob)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This voice... It's Rakosan. What's going on here...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sob) I remember how you loved sitting here, feeling the breeze, Xiao... You'd read your web novels here for hours... (sob) but now you'll never get to see how they end...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's for Xiao and Liuqi. The next is one...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's for Xiao and Liuqi. The next one is…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rakosan, I just saw your robot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, then I guess you've heard the recordings I made?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of my late colleagues used to work on the suspension platform, so I had the robots play my words for them… It's the only way I could think of to remember them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's thoughtful of you. Like you said, those lost to the Void Storm deserve to be remembered, but the memories don't all have to be sad ones. Maybe you should talk to Dhalifa about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That… makes sense. I just get emotional whenever I think about them. But you're right. I should ask Dhalifa's ideas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, I understand your thought, Rakosan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, I understand your thought, Rakosan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're the only two left, so it matters that we keep their stories alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it shouldn't all be sadness. Just like how the Spacetrek Observatory records both the light and the dark, we should remember their joy too, and pass those memories on to the people who'll come after us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We carry their best moments with us, Rakosan. So let go of that survivor's guilt, and live with hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dhalifa… you're right. I survived by chance, but that doesn't mean I wasn't meant to keep going… does it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. You've done so much to rebuild the Observatory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then… let's do it your way. I just remembered how Xiao used to throw his head back laughing, and how he'd get all worked up when recommending a novel. If I kept my old recordings, anyone listening would think he spent every day crying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Liuqi... Remember the day she brought pastry from home? Everyone was so happy that we all took half the day off to enjoy them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rakosan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I remember. Back then, she was...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Looks like they're alright now. I should leave them to their conversation.)
